meanings.definition: To mark or cut a surface with a sharp object
meanings.sent1: She used a key to scratch her name on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to scratch the furniture to sharpen its claws.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally scratch my phone screen with my keys.
meanings.sent4: The artist's words scratch at the surface of truth.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the pencil scratching on paper filled the room.

meanings.definition: A slight injury or mark on a surface
meanings.sent1: The scratch on the car was barely noticeable.
meanings.sent2: He got a scratch on his arm from playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The scratch on the table looked like a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: The scratch on the record made the music skip.
meanings.sent5: The scratch on the mirror distorted the reflection.

meanings.sent1: She had to scratch the itch on her back.
meanings.sent2: The puppy would scratch behind its ear with its paw.
meanings.sent3: I scratch my head when I'm confused.
meanings.sent4: The branches scratch against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The rough fabric scratch against her skin.

meanings.definition: A starting point or beginning, especially in sports or competition
meanings.sent1: The team will start from scratch in the next game.
meanings.sent2: He built his career from scratch with hard work.
meanings.sent3: The scratch of the race signaled the beginning.
meanings.sent4: She started her painting from scratch, with a blank canvas.
meanings.sent5: The scratch line on the track marked the starting point.
